subject: Relationships
title: What Your Body Says When You're Silent
description: One-minute skill: What Your Body Says When You're Silent.

hook.text: Crossed arms, averted eyes, a tight jaw. You haven't said a word â€” but your partner heard everything.

buildup.text: Albert Mehrabian's research suggests 93% of emotional communication is nonverbal: tone, posture, expression.

discovery.text: Couples unconsciously mirror each other's body language when they feel connected. Mismatch signals trouble.

twist.text: You can say 'I'm fine' while your body screams 'I'm hurt.' Partners learn to read the body, not the words.

climax.text: Nonverbal fluency is the hidden skill of great relationships. Words lie. Bodies almost never do.

punchline.text: Your body tells the truth your mouth is too polite to say.

quiz.question: What percentage of emotional communication is nonverbal?
